alert.note: Alert for Bureau; Henry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 2:57PM CDT until July 04 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL BUREAU AND NORTHEASTERN HENRY IL COUNTIES... At 257 PM CDT, gauge reports indicated that heavy rain has ended across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain fell in less than 90 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Observers report over 3 inches of rain near Princeton. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Princeton, Hennepin, Geneseo, Wyanet, Atkinson, Sheffield, Annawan, Tiskilwa, Buda, Bureau Junction, Hooppole, Malden, Manlius, Mineral, Dover, New Bedford, Thomas, Bureau County Fairgrounds, Coal Hollow and Zearing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 180 between mile markers 2 and 13. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 15 and 64. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
